meanings.definition: Find out for certain; make sure of.
meanings.sent1: I need to ascertain the time of the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She tried to ascertain the truth by asking questions.
meanings.sent3: Trying to ascertain if the cat could talk, the little girl meowed at it.
meanings.sent4: He could ascertain the storm approaching by the dark clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The detective worked hard to ascertain the identity of the mysterious caller.

meanings.sent1: To ascertain the answer, I checked the back of the book.
meanings.sent2: The scientist wanted to ascertain the cause of the unusual reaction.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to ascertain the secret behind the disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: She could ascertain his mood by the look on his face.
meanings.sent5: The explorer needed to ascertain the correct path through the dense jungle.
